name: WP Fossil
author: Zach Schnackel

sections.description:
A handy utility plugin that provides support for media queries and emulating CSS3 pseudo-classes and attribute selectors in Internet Explorer 6-8. Uses Selectivizr and Respond.js.

Uses conditional statements to only load these libraries in IE8 or older.
sections.installation:
1. Upload the wp-fossil folder to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
sections.faq:
Can you add `feature-x`?

Sure! I’m always open to knew ideas. Just create a new issue and I’ll take a gander.
sections.changelog:
1.0

  • Tested up to 3.8
  • Now using Bower and GruntJS to handle assets.
  • This puppy should be ready to go! Now considered feature-complete.

0.1

  • Initial release
